cards.name: Gaseous Form
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by enchanted creature.
cards.flavor:
"It's hard to hurt anyone when you're as transparent as your motives."
—Ertai, wizard adept

rulings.text: The enchanted creature can still attack and block.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by enchanted creature.

cards.name: Giant Tortoise
cards.text: Giant Tortoise gets +0/+3 as long as it's untapped.
cards.flavor: In the coastal states of Jhess and Valeron, "tortoise" is a synonym for "stubborn."
cards.originalText: Giant Tortoise gets +0/+3 as long as it's untapped.

cards.name: Glacial Wall
cards.text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
cards.flavor:
"There is no confusion as to the boundary of the archmage's territory."
—Ippin, master cartographer
cards.originalText: Defender

cards.name: Honden of Seeing Winds
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, draw a card for each Shrine you control.
cards.flavor: To the sorrow of all, its winds found sin in the hearts of those who once learned from its wisdom.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, draw a card for each Shrine you control.

cards.name: Hydroblast
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Counter target spell if it's red.
• Destroy target permanent if it's red.
cards.flavor: Fire can be savage, but it is fickle. Water is always true, its flow steady and world-shaping.

rulings.text: The decision to counter a spell or destroy a permanent is a decision made on announcement before the target is selected. If the spell is redirected, this mode can't be changed, so only targets of the selected type are valid.
Hydroblast can target any spell or permanent, not just a red one. It checks the color of the target only on resolution.

cards.originalText:
Choose one —
• Counter target spell if it's red.
• Destroy target permanent if it's red.

cards.name: Inkwell Leviathan
cards.text:
Trample
Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
cards.flavor:
"Into its maw went the seventh sea, never to be seen again while the world remains."
—Esper fable

foreignNames.name: 墨溜まりのリバイアサン

cards.originalText:
Islandwalk, trample
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

cards.name: Jace, the Mind Sculptor
cards.text:
+2: Look at the top card of target player's library. You may put that card on the bottom of that player's library.
0: Draw three cards, then put two cards from your hand on top of your library in any order.
−1: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
−12: Exile all cards from target player's library, then that player shuffles their hand into their library.

rulings.text: You draw three cards and put two cards back all while Jace's second ability is resolving. Nothing can happen between the two, and no player may choose to take actions.

If the targeted player for Jace's last ability has no cards in hand, that player shuffles nothing into their library, and that player's library will remain empty. That player won't lose the game until they try to draw from the empty library.

foreignNames.name: 精神を刻む者、ジェイス

cards.originalText:
+2: Look at the top card of target player's library. You may put that card on the bottom of that player's library.
0: Draw three cards, then put two cards from your hand on top of your library in any order.
−1: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
−12: Exile all cards from target player's library, then that player shuffles his or her hand into his or her library.

cards.name: Jetting Glasskite
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Jetting Glasskite becomes the target of a spell or ability for the first time each turn, counter that spell or ability.
cards.flavor: The bolt struck with a flash, and there was a terrible sound, as of glass shattering, but the creature was unharmed.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Jetting Glasskite becomes the target of a spell or ability for the first time each turn, counter that spell or ability.

cards.name: Man-o'-War
cards.text: When Man-o'-War enters the battlefield, return target creature to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"Beauty to the eye does not always translate to the touch."
—Naimah, Femeref philosopher

rulings.text: If there are no other creatures on the battlefield when Man-o'-War enters the battlefield, its ability must target itself.

cards.originalText: When Man-o'-War enters the battlefield, return target creature to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Memory Lapse
cards.text: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, put it on top of its owner's library instead of into that player's graveyard.
cards.flavor: What a lonely agony, the memory of memories lost.

rulings.text: Memory Lapse has a self-replacement effect that replaces the spell going to the graveyard before any other effect can replace that event. If the spell was cast using flashback, however, flashback will change the spell's destination from its owner's library to exile.

cards.originalText: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, put it on top of its owner's library instead of into that player's graveyard.

cards.name: Merfolk Looter
cards.text: {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
cards.flavor: Merfolk don't always know what they're looking for, but they're certain once they find it.

rulings.text: You can't do anything in between drawing a card and discarding a card, including casting or cycling the card you drew.

foreignNames.name: マーフォークの物あさり

cards.originalText: {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.

cards.name: Mystical Tutor
cards.text: Search your library for an instant or sorcery card and reveal that card. Shuffle your library, then put the card on top of it.
cards.flavor: The student searches the world for meaning. The master finds worlds of meaning in the search.

rulings.text: The "shuffle and put the card on top" is a single action. If an effect causes the top card of the library to be face up, the second card down is not revealed.

cards.originalText: Search your library for an instant or sorcery card and reveal that card. Shuffle your library, then put the card on top of it.

cards.name: Oona's Grace
cards.text:
Target player draws a card.
Retrace (You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)
cards.flavor: Oona grants her favored subjects a dream from her own guarded heart.

rulings.text: Casting a card by using its retrace ability works just like casting any other spell, with two exceptions: You're casting it from your graveyard rather than your hand, and you must discard a land card in addition to any other costs.
A retrace card cast from your graveyard follows the normal timing rules for its card type.
When a retrace card you cast from your graveyard resolves, fails to resolve, or is countered, it's put back into your graveyard. You may use the retrace ability to cast it again.

If the active player casts a spell that has retrace, that player may cast that card again after it resolves, before another player can remove the card from the graveyard. The active player has priority after the spell resolves, so they can immediately cast a new spell. Since casting a card with retrace from the graveyard moves that card onto the stack, no one else would have the chance to affect it while it's still in the graveyard.

cards.originalText:
Target player draws a card.
Retrace (You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)

cards.name: Peregrine Drake
cards.text:
Flying
When Peregrine Drake enters the battlefield, untap up to five lands.
cards.flavor:
"Always a welcome sight breaking through the clouds."
—Talrand, sky summoner

rulings.text: You choose which lands to untap as the triggered ability resolves. They aren't targeted, and they don't have to be lands that you control.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Peregrine Drake enters the battlefield, untap up to five lands.

cards.name: Phantom Monster
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: Is it an amalgamation of faded memories or the projection of a half-remembered dream? Neither answer offers any comfort.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Phyrexian Ingester
cards.text:
Imprint — When Phyrexian Ingester enters the battlefield, you may exile target nontoken creature.
Phyrexian Ingester gets +X/+Y, where X is the exiled creature card's power and Y is its toughness.

rulings.text: Phyrexian Ingester will get bonuses based on the card's power and toughness in exile. Counters, Auras, and Equipment it had on it before it was exiled won't add to those numbers.

Abilities that define a creature's power and toughness apply while that card is in exile, but abilities that add or subtract from it don't. For example, the ability of Battle Squadron applies to determine Phyrexian Ingester's power and toughness, but the ability of Werebear doesn't. Phyrexian Ingester's power and toughness are constantly updated if the exiled card's power and/or toughness change.
If the card in exile isn't a creature card (perhaps because it was a land that was temporarily a creature while on the battlefield), Phyrexian Ingester doesn't get a bonus.

foreignNames.name: ファイレクシアの摂取者

cards.originalText:
Imprint — When Phyrexian Ingester enters the battlefield, you may exile target nontoken creature.
Phyrexian Ingester gets +X/+Y, where X is the exiled creature card's power and Y is its toughness.

cards.name: Prodigal Sorcerer
cards.text: {T}: Prodigal Sorcerer deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: "You can't learn to enjoy life's amusements in the pages of books. You must seek them out in earnest."
cards.originalText: {T}: Prodigal Sorcerer deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Quiet Speculation
cards.text: Search target player's library for up to three cards with flashback and put them into that player's graveyard. Then the player shuffles their library.
cards.flavor:
"The best foresight is hindsight."
—Empress Llawan
cards.originalText: Search target player's library for up to three cards with flashback and put them into that player's graveyard. Then the player shuffles his or her library.

cards.name: Screeching Skaab
cards.text: When Screeching Skaab enters the battlefield, put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard.
cards.flavor: Its screeching is the sound of you losing your mind.
cards.originalText: When Screeching Skaab enters the battlefield, put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard.

cards.name: Serendib Efreet
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, Serendib Efreet deals 1 damage to you.
cards.flavor: Summoners of efreeti remember only the power of command, never the sting of regret.

foreignNames.name: セレンディブのイフリート

cards.originalText:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, Serendib Efreet deals 1 damage to you.

cards.name: Shoreline Ranger
cards.text:
Flying
Islandcycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for an Island card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.)
cards.originalText:
Flying
Islandcycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for an Island card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)

cards.name: Silent Departure
cards.text:
Return target creature to its owner's hand.
Flashback {4}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.flavor: The same magic that lets geists pass through our realm can force them out of it.
cards.originalText:
Return target creature to its owner's hand.
Flashback {4}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Sprite Noble
cards.text:
Flying
Other creatures you control with flying get +0/+1.
{T}: Other creatures you control with flying get +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "By thorn and by stone, we will fight to see the day when beauty returns to this world."
cards.originalText:
Flying
Other creatures you control with flying get +0/+1.
{T}: Other creatures you control with flying get +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Stupefying Touch
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Stupefying Touch enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Enchanted creature's activated abilities can't be activated.
cards.flavor: "A warrior without wit is simply meat."

rulings.text: Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]." Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.
Unlike many similar abilities, Stupefying Touch's last ability stops mana abilities from being activated.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
When Stupefying Touch enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Enchanted creature's activated abilities can't be activated.

cards.name: Tidal Wave
cards.text: Create a 5/5 blue Wall creature token with defender. Sacrifice it at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor:
"The floor of the sea is paved with the shattered remnants of vessels that navigated its surface unwelcomed."
—Thassa, god of the sea
cards.originalText: Put a 5/5 blue Wall creature token with defender onto the battlefield. Sacrifice it at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.name: Warden of Evos Isle
cards.text:
Flying
Creature spells with flying you cast cost {1} less to cast.
cards.flavor: On Evos Isle, the swift and formidable aven enforce the will of the ruling sphinxes.

rulings.text: A creature spell that doesn't have flying won't cost less even if the creature it will become will have flying once on the battlefield. For example, if you control an Island and Wonder is in your graveyard, creature spells won't cost {1} less even though those creatures will have flying once they're on the battlefield.
The ability can't reduce the colored mana requirement of a creature spell with flying.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Creature spells with flying you cast cost {1} less to cast.

cards.name: Wonder
cards.text:
Flying
As long as Wonder is in your graveyard and you control an Island, creatures you control have flying.
cards.flavor:
"The awestruck birds gazed at Wonder. Slowly, timidly, they rose into the air."
—Scroll of Beginnings
cards.originalText:
Flying
As long as Wonder is in your graveyard and you control an Island, creatures you control have flying.

cards.name: Animate Dead
cards.text:
Enchant creature card in a graveyard
When Animate Dead enters the battlefield, if it's on the battlefield, it loses "enchant creature card in a graveyard" and gains "enchant creature put onto the battlefield with Animate Dead." Return enchanted creature card to the battlefield under your control and attach Animate Dead to it. When Animate Dead leaves the battlefield, that creature's controller sacrifices it.
Enchanted creature gets -1/-0.

rulings.text: Animate Dead is an Aura, albeit with an unusual enchant ability. You target a creature card in a graveyard when you cast it. It enters the battlefield attached to that card. Then it returns that card to the battlefield, and attaches itself to the card again (since the card is a new object on the battlefield). Animate Dead itself never moves into a graveyard during this process.
If Animate Dead isn't on the battlefield as its triggered ability resolves, none of its effects happen. The creature card won't be returned to the battlefield.

Abilities such as shroud and protection function only on the battlefield unless otherwise specified. A creature card with shroud may be targeted by Animate Dead, and Animate Dead will become attached to the creature that enters the battlefield.

If the creature put onto the battlefield has protection from black—or if the creature can't legally be enchanted by Animate Dead for another reason—Animate Dead won't be able to attach to it. It will be put into the graveyard as a state-based action, causing its delayed triggered ability to trigger. When the trigger resolves, if the creature's still on the battlefield, its controller will sacrifice it.

Once the creature is returned to the battlefield, Animate Dead can't be attached to anything other than it (unless Animate Dead somehow manages to put a different creature onto the battlefield). Attempting to move Animate Dead to another creature won't work.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature card in a graveyard
When Animate Dead enters the battlefield, if it's on the battlefield, it loses "enchant creature card in a graveyard" and gains "enchant creature put onto the battlefield with Animate Dead." Return enchanted creature card to the battlefield under your control and attach Animate Dead to it. When Animate Dead leaves the battlefield, that creature's controller sacrifices it.
Enchanted creature gets -1/-0.

cards.name: Annihilate
cards.text:
Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Whatever Yawgmoth marks, dies. There is no escape."
—Tsabo Tavoc, Phyrexian general

rulings.text: If the targeted creature is an illegal target when Annihilate tries to resolve, the entire spell doesn't resolve. You won't draw a card.

cards.originalText:
Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Blightsoil Druid
cards.text: {T}, Pay 1 life: Add {G}.
cards.flavor: "See the beauty in death: the clean white bones lying in the fertile soil and the brightly colored moonglove sprouting from the fell earth."
cards.originalText: {T}, Pay 1 life: Add {G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Blood Artist
cards.text: Whenever Blood Artist or another creature dies, target player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: "Great art can never be created without great suffering."

rulings.text: If Blood Artist and one or more other creatures die at the same time, its ability will trigger for each of those creatures.

cards.originalText: Whenever Blood Artist or another creature dies, target player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Braids, Cabal Minion
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices an artifact, creature, or land.
cards.flavor: "Home is where you can find a decent graveyard and strangers can disappear without awkward questions."

rulings.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, triggered abilities you control will resolve after triggered abilities your opponents control. If an opponent controls Braids and you control a triggered ability that puts a permanent onto the battlefield, you won't be able to sacrifice that permanent to satisfy Braids's ability.

foreignNames.name: 陰謀団の先手ブレイズ

cards.originalText: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices an artifact, creature, or land.

cards.name: Cabal Therapy
cards.text:
Choose a nonland card name. Target player reveals their hand and discards all cards with that name.
Flashback—Sacrifice a creature. (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

rulings.text: You name the card as Cabal Therapy resolves, not as you cast it. Then the targeted player reveals their hand and discards if appropriate. No player may choose to take actions between you naming the card and the targeted player revealing and discarding.

cards.originalText:
Name a nonland card. Target player reveals his or her hand and discards all cards with that name.
Flashback—Sacrifice a creature. (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Carrion Feeder
cards.text:
Carrion Feeder can't block.
Sacrifice a creature: Put a +1/+1 counter on Carrion Feeder.
cards.flavor: Stinking of rot, it leaps between gravestones in search of its next meal.

rulings.text: You can sacrifice Carrion Feeder to activate its own ability. The ability will have no effect as it resolves.

cards.originalText:
Carrion Feeder can't block.
Sacrifice a creature: Put a +1/+1 counter on Carrion Feeder.

cards.name: Deadbridge Shaman
cards.text: When Deadbridge Shaman dies, target opponent discards a card.
cards.flavor: Ending her life won't end the infestation.
cards.originalText: When Deadbridge Shaman dies, target opponent discards a card.

cards.name: Duress
cards.text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a noncreature, nonland card from it. That player discards that card.
cards.flavor:
"Don't worry. I'm not going to deprive you of all your secrets. Just your most precious one."
—Liliana Vess
cards.originalText: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a noncreature, nonland card from it. That player discards that card.

cards.name: Entomb
cards.text: Search your library for a card and put that card into your graveyard. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor:
"I'll return once you've ripened."
—Ghoulcaller Gisa
cards.originalText: Search your library for a card and put that card into your graveyard. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Eyeblight's Ending
cards.text: Destroy target non-Elf creature.
cards.flavor:
"Those without beauty are Lorwyn's greatest tumor. The winnowers have an unpleasant duty, but a necessary one."
—Eidren, perfect of Lys Alana
cards.originalText: Destroy target non-Elf creature.

cards.name: Gravedigger
cards.text: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: A full coffin is like a full coffer—both are attractive to thieves.

rulings.text: A "creature card" is any card with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact, enchantment, or land. Older cards of type summon are also creature cards.

cards.originalText: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Havoc Demon
cards.text:
Flying
When Havoc Demon dies, all creatures get -5/-5 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: A cry of pain as it enters this world. A chorus of screams as it leaves.

rulings.text: All creatures on the battlefield when Havoc Demon's triggered ability resolves are affected. Ones that enter the battlefield or become creatures later in the turn are not.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Havoc Demon dies, all creatures get -5/-5 until end of turn.

cards.name: Honden of Night's Reach
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, target opponent discards a card for each Shrine you control.
cards.flavor: To the sorrow of all, its dark reach grasped and crushed those who guarded its silent vigil.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, target opponent discards a card for each Shrine you control.

cards.name: Hymn to Tourach
cards.text: Target player discards two cards at random.
cards.flavor: The priests plead for your anguish and pray for your despair.
cards.originalText: Target player discards two cards at random.

cards.name: Ichorid
cards.text:
Haste
At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Ichorid.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Ichorid is in your graveyard, you may exile a black creature card other than Ichorid from your graveyard. If you do, return Ichorid to the battlefield.

rulings.text: If multiple Ichorids are in your graveyard, you can't exile the same creature card to return each of them to the battlefield.
If one Ichorid's ability exiles another, the exiled Ichorid's ability can't return it to the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
Haste
At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Ichorid.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Ichorid is in your graveyard, you may exile a black creature card other than Ichorid from your graveyard. If you do, return Ichorid to the battlefield.

cards.name: Innocent Blood
cards.text: Each player sacrifices a creature.
cards.flavor: Zombies mourn for the living and celebrate those who will soon be given the gift of death.

rulings.text: You can cast Innocent Blood even if some (or all) players control no creatures. Those players are simply unaffected.

cards.originalText: Each player sacrifices a creature.

cards.name: Lys Alana Scarblade
cards.text: {T}, Discard an Elf card: Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the number of Elves you control.
cards.flavor: In beauty-obsessed Lys Alana, one cut of her blade means the difference between a high society feast and raking through the dungheap for scraps.

rulings.text: The number of Elves you control is counted only as Lys Alana Scarblade's ability resolves. If Lys Alana Scarblade is still on the battlefield, it'll count itself.

cards.originalText: {T}, Discard an Elf card: Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the number of Elves you control.

cards.name: Malicious Affliction
cards.text:
Morbid — When you cast this spell, if a creature died this turn, you may copy Malicious Affliction and may choose a new target for the copy.
Destroy target nonblack creature.
cards.flavor:
"Such an affliction appears to seek out the pure."
—Byro, plague doctor

rulings.text: The copy of Malicious Affliction is created on the stack. It's not cast, so the copy won't cause the morbid ability to trigger again.

The copy will have the same target as the original spell unless you choose a new one. You don't have to change this target if you don't want to or can't choose a new legal target (perhaps because there are no other nonblack creatures on the battlefield).

cards.originalText:
Morbid — When you cast Malicious Affliction, if a creature died this turn, you may copy Malicious Affliction and may choose a new target for the copy.
Destroy target nonblack creature.

cards.name: Nausea
cards.text: All creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Was it something I said?"

rulings.text: All creatures on the battlefield when Nausea resolves are affected. Ones that enter the battlefield or become creatures later in the turn are not.

cards.originalText: All creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Necropotence
cards.text:
Skip your draw step.
Whenever you discard a card, exile that card from your graveyard.
Pay 1 life: Exile the top card of your library face down. Put that card into your hand at the beginning of your next end step.

rulings.text: If a discarded card isn't put into your graveyard (due to an effect such as that of Obstinate Baloth) or leaves your graveyard (perhaps because another effect returned it to your hand), it won't be exiled.
If you discard a card with madness and wish to cast it, Necropotence's ability won't exile that card. If you don't wish to cast it, you choose whether it ends up exiled or in your graveyard.

Necropotence's last ability creates a delayed triggered ability that will put the exiled card into your hand. That ability still triggers even if Necropotence is removed from the battlefield before your end step.

cards.originalText:
Skip your draw step.
Whenever you discard a card, exile that card from your graveyard.
Pay 1 life: Exile the top card of your library face down. Put that card into your hand at the beginning of your next end step.

cards.name: Nekrataal
cards.text:
First strike
When Nekrataal enters the battlefield, destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. That creature can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor: His victims don't have time to feel despair.

rulings.text: Nothing happens if there are no nonartifact, nonblack creatures on the battlefield when Nekrataal enters the battlefield, but if there is one, you must target it, even if it's a creature you control.

cards.originalText:
First strike
When Nekrataal enters the battlefield, destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. That creature can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Night's Whisper
cards.text: You draw two cards and you lose 2 life.
cards.flavor:
"I have seen things that would reduce a weaker person to blubbering and raving. Want to hear about them?"
—Vraska
cards.originalText: You draw two cards and you lose 2 life.

cards.name: Phyrexian Gargantua
cards.text: When Phyrexian Gargantua enters the battlefield, you draw two cards and you lose 2 life.
cards.flavor: Other Phyrexians have nightmares about the gargantua.

foreignNames.name: ファイレクシアのガルガンチュア

cards.originalText: When Phyrexian Gargantua enters the battlefield, you draw two cards and you lose 2 life.

cards.name: Phyrexian Rager
cards.text: When Phyrexian Rager enters the battlefield, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"I believe many worlds will bow to Phyrexia. Mirrodin is merely the first."
—Sheoldred, Whispering One

foreignNames.name: ファイレクシアの憤怒鬼

cards.originalText: When Phyrexian Rager enters the battlefield, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.

cards.name: Plague Witch
cards.text: {B}, {T}, Discard a card: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "I can ail what cures you."
cards.originalText: {B}, {T}, Discard a card: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Prowling Pangolin

cards.originalText: When Prowling Pangolin enters the battlefield, any player may sacrifice two creatures. If a player does, sacrifice Prowling Pangolin.

cards.name: Sengir Autocrat
cards.text:
When Sengir Autocrat enters the battlefield, create three 0/1 black Serf creature tokens.
When Sengir Autocrat leaves the battlefield, exile all Serf tokens.
cards.flavor: "The penalty for idleness is death. The penalty for disputing the penalty is death."

rulings.text: Sengir Autocrat's last ability exiles all Serf tokens, not just the Serf tokens its first ability created.

If Sengir Autocrat leaves the battlefield while its first ability is on the stack, its second ability triggers and exiles any Serf tokens that happen to be on the battlefield, and then its first ability resolves and gives you three Serf tokens.

cards.originalText:
When Sengir Autocrat enters the battlefield, put three 0/1 black Serf creature tokens onto the battlefield.
When Sengir Autocrat leaves the battlefield, exile all Serf tokens.

cards.name: Sinkhole
cards.text: Destroy target land.
cards.flavor: High walls, a sturdy keep, a strong garrison . . . they made no difference. In a matter of moments, the city was lost.
cards.originalText: Destroy target land.

cards.name: Skulking Ghost
cards.text:
Flying
When Skulking Ghost becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it.
cards.flavor:
"They exist only so long as the living take no notice."
—Kifimbo, Shadow guildmage

rulings.text: You'll sacrifice this creature even if you counter the spell or ability that targets it. If that spell has no other targets, it'll be countered when it tries to resolve.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Skulking Ghost becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it.

cards.name: Toxic Deluge
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, pay X life.
All creatures get -X/-X until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"It's a difficult task to quarantine a plague that moves with the clouds."
—Esara, healer adept

rulings.text: The payment of life is an additional cost. You lose the life even if Toxic Deluge is countered.
If you cast Toxic Deluge without paying its mana cost, you'll still choose a value for X and pay X life. This is because it doesn't have {X} in its mana cost.
All creatures on the battlefield when Toxic Deluge resolves are affected. Ones that enter the battlefield or become creatures later in the turn are not.

cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to cast Toxic Deluge, pay X life.
All creatures get -X/-X until end of turn.

cards.name: Tragic Slip
cards.text:
Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
Morbid — That creature gets -13/-13 until end of turn instead if a creature died this turn.
cards.flavor: Linger on death's door and risk being invited in.
cards.originalText:
Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
Morbid — That creature gets -13/-13 until end of turn instead if a creature died this turn.

cards.name: Twisted Abomination
cards.text:
{B}: Regenerate Twisted Abomination.
Swampcycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Swamp card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.)

rulings.text: Unlike the normal cycling ability, Swampcycling doesn't allow you to draw a card. Instead, it lets you search your library for a Swamp card. After you find a Swamp card in your library, you reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

Swampcycling is a form of cycling. Any ability that triggers on a card being cycled also triggers on Swampcycling this card. Any ability that stops a cycling ability from being activated also stops Swampcycling from being activated.

Swampcycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with Swampcycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
You can choose to find any card with the Swamp land type, including nonbasic lands. You can also choose not to find a card, even if there is a Swamp card in your library.

cards.originalText:
{B}: Regenerate Twisted Abomination.
Swampcycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Swamp card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)

cards.name: Urborg Uprising
cards.text:
Return up to two target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: In Urborg, few things are less permanent than death.

rulings.text: You can cast Urborg Uprising with zero targets if you only want to draw a card.
If you chose at least one target and all targets are illegal on resolution, you won't draw a card.

foreignNames.name: 立ち上がるアーボーグ

cards.originalText:
Return up to two target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Vampiric Tutor
cards.text: Search your library for a card, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it. You lose 2 life.
cards.flavor: True power is achieved through blood and sweat. But mostly blood.

rulings.text: The "shuffle and put the card on top" is a single action. If an effect causes the top card of the library to be face up, the second card down is not revealed.

cards.originalText: Search your library for a card, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it. You lose 2 life.

cards.name: Victimize
cards.text: Choose two target creature cards in your graveyard. Sacrifice a creature. If you do, return the chosen cards to the battlefield tapped.
cards.flavor:
"Die. But die knowing that your pathetic life will yield a great bounty for me."
—Zul Ashur, lich lord

rulings.text: You must choose two targets. You can't cast Victimize targeting only one creature card.
The creature you sacrifice isn't chosen until Victimize resolves. You can't return the creature you sacrifice because it will still be on the battlefield at the time targets are chosen.
As Victimize resolves, you must sacrifice a creature if able. You can't change your mind and choose not to sacrifice anything.

If one of the targeted creature cards is an illegal target (for instance, because it has left your graveyard before Victimize resolves), you'll still sacrifice a creature and put the other card onto the battlefield. If both are illegal targets, Victimize won't resolve. You won't sacrifice a creature.
Victimize can be used to put both parts of the B.F.M. onto the battlefield at once.

cards.originalText: Choose two target creature cards in your graveyard. Sacrifice a creature. If you do, return the chosen cards to the battlefield tapped.

cards.name: Visara the Dreadful
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor: "My eyes are my strongest feature."

foreignNames.name: 戦慄をなす者ヴィザラ

cards.originalText:
Flying
{T}: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Wake of Vultures
cards.text:
Flying
{1}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Regenerate Wake of Vultures.
cards.flavor:
"So the vulture said to the griffin, 'You gonna eat that?'"
—Azeworai, "The Ugly Bird"

rulings.text: You can sacrifice Wake of Vultures to activate its own ability. The ability will have no effect as it resolves.

cards.originalText:
Flying
{1}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Regenerate Wake of Vultures.

cards.name: Wakedancer
cards.text: Morbid — When Wakedancer enters the battlefield, if a creature died this turn, create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.
cards.flavor: Hers is an ancient form of necromancy, steeped in shamanic trance and ritual that few skaberen or ghoulcallers comprehend.
cards.originalText: Morbid — When Wakedancer enters the battlefield, if a creature died this turn, put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Avarax
cards.text:
Haste
When Avarax enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a card named Avarax, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
{1}{R}: Avarax gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
Haste
When Avarax enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a card named Avarax, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
{1}{R}: Avarax gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Battle Squadron
cards.text:
Flying
Battle Squadron's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures you control.
cards.flavor: The goblins made an unruly pile with military precision.

rulings.text: Battle Squadron's last ability applies in all zones. While it's on the battlefield, it counts itself, so it'll be at least 1/1.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Battle Squadron's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures you control.

cards.name: Beetleback Chief
cards.text: When Beetleback Chief enters the battlefield, create two 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.
cards.flavor: Whether trained, ridden, or eaten, few goblin military innovations have rivaled the bug.
cards.originalText: When Beetleback Chief enters the battlefield, put two 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Borderland Marauder
cards.text: Whenever Borderland Marauder attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Though she is rightly feared, there are relatively few tales of her deeds in battle, for few survive her raids.
cards.originalText: Whenever Borderland Marauder attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Burning Vengeance
cards.text: Whenever you cast a spell from your graveyard, Burning Vengeance deals 2 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Mist is the geists' sorrow. Wind is their pain. Fire is their vengeance.

rulings.text: Although flashback and retrace are the most common ways to cast a spell from your graveyard, Burning Vengeance will trigger whenever you cast a spell from your graveyard through any means.
Burning Vengeance doesn't trigger when you activate an ability of a card in your graveyard, such as unearth or the ability of Reassembling Skeleton.
Burning Vengeance's triggered ability will resolve before the spell you cast from your graveyard.

cards.originalText: Whenever you cast a spell from your graveyard, Burning Vengeance deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Carbonize
cards.text: Carbonize deals 3 damage to any target. If it's a creature, it can't be regenerated this turn, and if it would die this turn, exile it instead.
cards.flavor:
"There's no coming back from that."
—Jaya Ballard

rulings.text: The targeted creature can't be regenerated and is exiled if it would die no matter why it would die this turn. It doesn't have to be destroyed because of the damage Carbonize deals to it.

cards.originalText: Carbonize deals 3 damage to target creature or player. That creature can't be regenerated this turn. If the creature would die this turn, exile it instead.

cards.name: Chain Lightning
cards.text: Chain Lightning deals 3 damage to any target. Then that player or that permanent's controller may pay {R}{R}. If the player does, they may copy this spell and may choose a new target for that copy.

rulings.text: The copy is a spell, so it can be targeted by other spells and abilities that target a spell.
The player putting the copy spell on the stack controls that spell.
The spell copy has all the text and can result in itself being copied.

As Chain Lightning resolves, the targeted player or the controller of the targeted creature may copy it. The copy has the same text, target, and color of the resolving spell, though the player who's copying it may choose a new target for it. Once that copy is created (or not), the first Chain Lightning has finished resolving and leaves the stack.
The player putting the copy of the spell on the stack controls that copy.
The copy of Chain Lightning is created on the stack, so it's not cast. Abilities that trigger when a player casts a spell won't trigger. Players may respond to that spell before it resolves.
If the targeted permanent or player is an illegal target when Chain Lightning tries to resolve, the spell doesn't resolve. It can't be copied.

cards.originalText: Chain Lightning deals 3 damage to target creature or player. Then that player or that creature's controller may pay {R}{R}. If the player does, he or she may copy this spell and may choose a new target for that copy.

cards.name: Crater Hellion
cards.text:
Echo {4}{R}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Crater Hellion enters the battlefield, it deals 4 damage to each other creature.
cards.originalText:
Echo {4}{R}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Crater Hellion enters the battlefield, it deals 4 damage to each other creature.

cards.name: Desperate Ravings
cards.text:
Draw two cards, then discard a card at random.
Flashback {2}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.flavor: Her mind was quite gone, yet she spoke nothing but truth.

rulings.text: You draw two cards and discard one randomly all while Desperate Ravings is resolving. Nothing can happen between the two, and no player may choose to take actions.

cards.originalText:
Draw two cards, then discard a card at random.
Flashback {2}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Dragon Egg
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
When Dragon Egg dies, create a 2/2 red Dragon creature token with flying and "{R}: This creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn."
cards.flavor: Dragon birth lairs are littered with treasure to entice the young from their eggs.
cards.originalText:
Defender
When Dragon Egg dies, put a 2/2 red Dragon creature token with flying onto the battlefield. It has "{R}: This creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn."

cards.name: Dualcaster Mage
cards.text:
Flash
When Dualcaster Mage enters the battlefield, copy target instant or sorcery spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.
cards.flavor: "It has been my experience that disasters like to strike in pairs."

rulings.text: Dualcaster Mage's triggered ability can target (and copy) any instant or sorcery spell, not just one with targets. It doesn't matter who controls it.
As Dualcaster Mage's triggered ability resolves, it creates a copy of a spell on the stack. The copy isn't cast, so abilities that trigger when a player casts a spell won't trigger.

The copy will have the same targets as the spell it's copying unless you choose new ones. You may change any number of the targets, including all of them or none of them. If, for one of the targets, you can't choose a new legal target, then it remains unchanged (even if the current target is illegal).

You can't choose to pay any additional costs for the copy. However, effects based on any additional or alternative costs paid for the targeted spell are copied as though those same costs were paid for the copy.
If the spell is modal (that is, it says "Choose one —" or the like), the copy will have the same mode. You can't choose a different one.
If the spell has an X whose value was determined as it was cast (like Earthquake does), the copy has the same value of X.

If the copy says that it affects "you," it affects the controller of the copy, not the controller of the original spell. Similarly, if the copy says that it affects an "opponent," it affects an opponent of the copy's controller, not an opponent of the original spell's controller.

cards.originalText:
Flash
When Dualcaster Mage enters the battlefield, copy target instant or sorcery spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.

cards.name: Faithless Looting
cards.text:
Draw two cards, then discard two cards.
Flashback {2}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.flavor: "Avacyn has abandoned us! We have nothing left except what we can take!"

rulings.text: You draw two cards and discard two cards all while Faithless Looting is resolving. Nothing can happen between the two, and no player may choose to take actions.

cards.originalText:
Draw two cards, then discard two cards.
Flashback {2}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Fervent Cathar
cards.text:
Haste
When Fervent Cathar enters the battlefield, target creature can't block this turn.
cards.flavor: "I'll put my sword down only to die. And I don't plan on doing that today."

rulings.text: The targeted creature can't block any creatures this turn. The effect doesn't merely restrict whether it can block Fervent Cathar.

cards.originalText:
Haste
When Fervent Cathar enters the battlefield, target creature can't block this turn.

cards.name: Firebolt
cards.text:
Firebolt deals 2 damage to any target.
Flashback {4}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.flavor: "There's more where that came from!"
cards.originalText:
Firebolt deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
Flashback {4}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Flame Jab
cards.text:
Flame Jab deals 1 damage to any target.
Retrace (You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)
cards.flavor:
"Fire's out. Should be safe now."
—Gnarltrunk

rulings.text: Casting a card by using its retrace ability works just like casting any other spell, with two exceptions: You're casting it from your graveyard rather than your hand, and you must discard a land card in addition to any other costs.
A retrace card cast from your graveyard follows the normal timing rules for its card type.
When a retrace card you cast from your graveyard resolves, fails to resolve, or is countered, it's put back into your graveyard. You may use the retrace ability to cast it again.

If the active player casts a spell that has retrace, that player may cast that card again after it resolves, before another player can remove the card from the graveyard. The active player has priority after the spell resolves, so they can immediately cast a new spell. Since casting a card with retrace from the graveyard moves that card onto the stack, no one else would have the chance to affect it while it's still in the graveyard.

cards.originalText:
Flame Jab deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
Retrace (You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)

cards.name: Gamble
cards.text: Search your library for a card, put that card into your hand, discard a card at random, then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: "What's the worst that can happen?"

rulings.text: You might end up discarding the card you searched for.
You put the card into your hand and discard a card at random all while Gamble is resolving. Nothing can happen between the two, and no player may choose to take actions.

cards.originalText: Search your library for a card, put that card into your hand, discard a card at random, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Ghitu Slinger
cards.text:
Echo {2}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Ghitu Slinger enters the battlefield, it deals 2 damage to any target.
cards.originalText:
Echo {2}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Ghitu Slinger enters the battlefield, it deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Honden of Infinite Rage
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, Honden of Infinite Rage deals damage to any target equal to the number of Shrines you control.
cards.flavor: To the sorrow of all, its rage became focused on those who once stoked it.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, Honden of Infinite Rage deals damage to target creature or player equal to the number of Shrines you control.

cards.name: Keldon Champion
cards.text:
Haste
Echo {2}{R}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Keldon Champion enters the battlefield, it deals 3 damage to target player or planeswalker.

foreignNames.name: ケルドのチャンピオン

cards.originalText:
Haste
Echo {2}{R}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Keldon Champion enters the battlefield, it deals 3 damage to target player.

cards.name: Keldon Marauders
cards.text:
Vanishing 2 (This creature enters the battlefield with two time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter from it. When the last is removed, sacrifice it.)
When Keldon Marauders enters the battlefield or leaves the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to target player or planeswalker.
cards.originalText:
Vanishing 2 (This creature enters the battlefield with two time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter from it. When the last is removed, sacrifice it.)
When Keldon Marauders enters the battlefield or leaves the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to target player.

cards.name: Kird Ape
cards.text: Kird Ape gets +1/+2 as long as you control a Forest.
cards.flavor: It puts the "fur" in "fury."
cards.originalText: Kird Ape gets +1/+2 as long as you control a Forest.

cards.name: Mogg Fanatic
cards.text: Sacrifice Mogg Fanatic: It deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: "I got it! I got it! I—"

rulings.text: Once Mogg Fanatic has dealt and been dealt combat damage, it's too late to activate its ability before it's destroyed.

cards.originalText: Sacrifice Mogg Fanatic: Mogg Fanatic deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Mogg War Marshal
cards.text:
Echo {1}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Mogg War Marshal enters the battlefield or dies, create a 1/1 red Goblin creature token.
cards.originalText:
Echo {1}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Mogg War Marshal enters the battlefield or dies, put a 1/1 red Goblin creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Orcish Oriflamme
cards.text: Attacking creatures you control get +1/+0.
cards.flavor: The orcs' banner sends a clear message: "Stand against us and meet the same fate as the goblins."
cards.originalText: Attacking creatures you control get +1/+0.

cards.name: Price of Progress
cards.text: Price of Progress deals damage to each player equal to twice the number of nonbasic lands that player controls.
cards.flavor: Enthusiasm can be tempered in the furnace of the earth.
cards.originalText: Price of Progress deals damage to each player equal to twice the number of nonbasic lands that player controls.

cards.name: Pyroblast
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Counter target spell if it's blue.
• Destroy target permanent if it's blue.
cards.flavor: Water can be crushing, but it is predictable. Fire is always dynamic, its rage absolute and all-consuming.

rulings.text: The decision to counter a spell or destroy a permanent is a decision made on announcement before the target is selected. If the spell is redirected, this mode can't be changed, so only targets of the selected type are valid.
Pyroblast can target any spell or permanent, not just a blue one. It checks the color of the target only on resolution.

cards.originalText:
Choose one —
• Counter target spell if it's blue.
• Destroy target permanent if it's blue.

cards.name: Pyrokinesis
cards.text:
You may exile a red card from your hand rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Pyrokinesis deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures.

rulings.text: The number of targets must be at least one and at most four. Each target must be assigned at least 1 damage.

You divide the damage as you cast Pyrokinesis, not as it resolves. If any of the targets become illegal, damage is dealt to the other targets as originally assigned. If all targets are illegal, Pyrokinesis doesn't resolve.
If another effect causes Pyrokinesis to cost more, you must pay that additional cost even if you pay its alternative cost.

cards.originalText:
You may exile a red card from your hand rather than pay Pyrokinesis's mana cost.
Pyrokinesis deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures.

cards.name: Reckless Charge
cards.text:
Target creature gets +3/+0 and gains haste until end of turn.
Flashback {2}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.originalText:
Target creature gets +3/+0 and gains haste until end of turn.
Flashback {2}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Rorix Bladewing
cards.text: Flying, haste
cards.flavor: In an attempt to restore pride to Shiv and to forge an undying legacy, Rorix traveled far to compete for glory in Otaria's Grand Coliseum.
cards.originalText: Flying, haste

cards.name: Seismic Stomp
cards.text: Creatures without flying can't block this turn.
cards.flavor:
"It is not in me to tread lightly."
—Ryda, geomancer

rulings.text: No creature without flying will be able to block that turn, including creatures that lose flying after Seismic Stomp resolves and creatures without flying that enter the battlefield after Seismic Stomp resolves.

cards.originalText: Creatures without flying can't block this turn.

cards.name: Siege-Gang Commander
cards.text:
When Siege-Gang Commander enters the battlefield, create three 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.
{1}{R}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Siege-Gang Commander deals 2 damage to any target.

rulings.text: You can sacrifice any Goblin you control to activate Siege-Gang Commander's activated ability, not just the ones its triggered ability puts onto the battlefield. You can even sacrifice Siege-Gang Commander itself.

cards.originalText:
When Siege-Gang Commander enters the battlefield, put three 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens onto the battlefield.
{1}{R}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Siege-Gang Commander deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Sneak Attack
cards.text: {R}: You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield. That creature gains haste. Sacrifice the creature at the beginning of the next end step.

rulings.text: Putting the card onto the battlefield is optional. When the ability resolves, you can choose not to.

You only sacrifice the creature if you still control it at end of turn. If that creature has left the battlefield, even if it came back, you don't sacrifice it. Likewise, if an opponent has gained control of it, it won't be sacrificed and will remain on the battlefield indefinitely.
Putting a card onto the battlefield is optional. When the ability resolves, you can choose not to, even if you have one in your hand.

cards.originalText: {R}: You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield. That creature gains haste. Sacrifice the creature at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.name: Stingscourger
cards.text:
Echo {3}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Stingscourger enters the battlefield, return target creature an opponent controls to its owner's hand.
cards.originalText:
Echo {3}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Stingscourger enters the battlefield, return target creature an opponent controls to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Sulfuric Vortex
cards.text:
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Sulfuric Vortex deals 2 damage to that player.
If a player would gain life, that player gains no life instead.
cards.originalText:
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Sulfuric Vortex deals 2 damage to that player.
If a player would gain life, that player gains no life instead.
